info.title: Exchange API
info.description:
Note: Test the API with curl:

curl -sS -u <org>/iamapikey:<key> https://<host>:<port>/edge-exchange/v1/orgs/... | jq

This API specification is intended to be used by developers

post.summary: Deletes the tables from the database
post.description: Deletes the tables from the Exchange database. **Warning: this will delete the data too!** Because this is a dangerous method, you must first get a one-time token using GET /admin/dropdb/token, and use that to authenticate to this REST API method. Can only be run by the root User.

post.summary: Creates the table schema in the DB
post.description: Creates the tables with the necessary schema in the Exchange DB. This is now called at exchange startup, if necessary. Can only be run by the root user.

get.summary: Returns the org-specific status of the Exchange server
get.description: Returns a dictionary of statuses/statistics. Can be run by superuser, hub admins, and org admins.

post.summary: Tells the exchange reread its config file
post.description: Directs the exchange server to reread /etc/horizon/exchange/config.json and continue running with those new settings. Can only be run by the root user.

get.summary: Returns status of the Exchange server
get.description: Returns a dictionary of statuses/statistics. Can be run by any user.

get.summary: Returns summary status of the org
get.description: Returns the totals of key resources in the org. Can be run by any id in this org or a hub admin.

get.summary: Returns the version of the Exchange server
get.description: Returns the version of the Exchange server as a simple string (no JSON or quotes). Can be run by anyone.

get.summary: Gets a 1-time token for deleting the DB
get.description: Returns a timed token that can be given to POST /admin/dropdb. The token is good for 10 minutes. Since dropping the DB tables deletes all of their data, this is a way of confirming you really want to do it. This can only be run as root.

get.summary: Get all agent file versions
get.description: Get all agent certificate, configuration, and software file versions. Run by agreement bot

put.description: Put all agent certificate, configuration, and software file versions. Run by agreement bot

delete.summary: Delete all agent file versions
delete.description: Delete all agent certificate, configuration, and software file versions. Run by agreement bot

get.summary: Returns an Agreement Bot (AgBot)
get.description: Returns the AgBot with the specified identifier. Can be run by a User or the AgBot.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only a single attribute can be specified. If not specified, the entire node resource (including services) will be returned

put.description: This must be called by the User to add an AgBot, and then can be called by that User or AgBot to update itself.

delete.summary: Deletes an Agreement Bot (AgBot)
delete.description: Also deletes the agreements stored for this AgBot (but does not actually cancel the agreements between the Nodes and AgBot). Can be run by the owning User or the Agbot.

patch.summary: Updates one attribute of an Agreement Bo (Agbot)
patch.description: This can be called by the User or the AgBot.

requestBody.description: Specify only **one** of the following attributes

get.summary: Returns all Agreement Bots
get.description: Returns all Agreement Bots (AgBots). Can be run by any User.

parameters.name: idfilter
parameters.description: Filter results to only include AgBots with this identifier (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter results to only include AgBots with this name (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter results to only include AgBots with this owner (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

post.summary: Tells the Exchange this Agreement Bot is still operating
post.description: Lets the Exchange know this Agreement Bot (AgBot) is still active. Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

get.summary: Returns an Agreement for an Agreement Bot (AgBot)
get.description: Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

put.summary: Adds/updates an Agreement of an Agreement Bot (AgBot)
put.description: This is called by the owning User or the AgBot to give their information about the Agreement.

delete.summary: Deletes an Agreement of an Agreement Bot (AgBot)
delete.description: Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

get.summary: Returns all Agreements this Agreement Bot (AgBot) is apart of.
get.description: Can be run by the owning User or the Agbot.

delete.summary: Deletes all Agreements this Agreement Bot (AgBot) has.
delete.description: Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

post.summary: Confirms if this agbot agreement is active
post.description: Confirms whether or not this agreement id is valid, is owned by an agbot owned by this same username, and is a currently active agreement. Can only be run by an agbot or user.

get.summary: Returns a Pattern this Agreement Bot is serving
get.description: Returns the specified Pattern with the for the specified Agreement Bot (AgBot). The deploymentpattern should be in the form patternOrgid_pattern. Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

delete.summary: Deletes a Deployment Pattern of an Agreement Bot
delete.description: Deletes a Deployment Pattern that this Agreement Bot (AgBot) was serving. Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

get.summary: Returns all patterns served by this agbot
get.description: Returns all patterns that this agbot is finding nodes for to make agreements with them. Can be run by the owning user or the agbot.

parameters.name: deployment_pattern_organization
parameters.description: Filter by the Organization of a Deployment Pattern

parameters.name: node_organization
parameters.description: Filter by the Organization of a Node

post.summary: Adds a Deployment Pattern that the Agreement Bot should serve
post.description: Adds a new Deployment Pattern and Organization that this Agreement Bot (AgBot) should find Nodes for to make agreements with them. This is called by the owning User or the AgBot to give their information about the Deployment Pattern.

delete.summary: Deletes all Deployement Patterns of an Agreement Bot
delete.description: Deletes all of the current Deployment Patterns that this Agreement Bot (AgBot) was serving. Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

get.summary: Returns all Deployment Policies served by this Agreement Bot (AgBot)
get.description: Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

parameters.name: deployment_policy_organization
parameters.description: Filter by the Organization of a Deployment Policy

parameters.name: node_organization
parameters.description: Filter by the Organization of a Node

post.summary: Adds a Deployment Policy that this Agreement Bot (AgBot) should serve
post.description: This AgBot should find Nodes for this Deployment Policy to make agreements with. This is called by the owning User or the AgBot to give their information about the Deployment Policy.

delete.summary: Deletes all Deployment Policies this Agreement Bot (AgBot) is serving.
delete.description: Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

get.summary: Returns a Deployment Policy this Agreement Bot (AgBot) is serving
get.description: The buspolid should be in the form businessPolOrgid_businessPol. Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

delete.summary: Deletes a Deployment Policy this Agreement Bot (AgBot) is serving
delete.description: Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

get.summary: Returns A specific Message that has been sent to this Agreement Bot (AgBot).
get.description: Deleted/post-TTL (Time To Live) Messages will not be returned. Can be run by a User or the AgBot.

delete.summary: Deletes a Message of an Agreement Bot (AgBot)
delete.description: This should be done by the AgBot after each Message is read. Can be run by the owning User or the AgBot.

get.summary: Returns all Messages sent to this Agreement Bot (AgBot).
get.description: They will be returned in the order they were sent. All Messages that have been sent to this AgBot will be returned, unless the AgBot has deleted some, or some are past their TTL. Can be run by a User or the AgBot.

parameters.name: maxmsgs
parameters.description: Maximum number of Messages returned. If this is less than the number of Messages available, the oldest Messages are returned. Defaults to unlimited.

post.summary: Sends a Message from a Node to an Agreement Bot (AgBot)
post.description: The Node must first sign the Message (with its private key) and then encrypt the msg (with the AgBot's public key). Can be run by any Node.

get.summary: Returns patterns in the IBM catalog
get.description: Returns public pattern definitions from orgs of the specified orgtype (default is IBM). Can be run by any user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: orgtype
parameters.description: Filter results to only include orgs with this org type. A common org type is 'IBM'.

get.summary: Returns services in the IBM catalog
get.description: Returns public service definitions from orgs of the specified orgtype (default is IBM). Can be run by any user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: orgtype
parameters.description: Filter results to only include orgs with this org type. A common org type is 'IBM'.

get.summary: Returns a pattern
get.description: Returns the pattern with the specified id. Can be run by a user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only 1 attribute can be specified. If not specified, the entire pattern resource will be returned

put.description: Creates a pattern resource. A pattern resource specifies all of the services that should be deployed for a type of node. When a node registers with Horizon, it can specify a pattern name to quickly tell Horizon what should be deployed on it. This can only be called by a user.

requestBody.description: See details in the POST route.

post.summary: Adds a pattern
post.description: Creates a pattern resource. A pattern resource specifies all of the services that should be deployed for a type of node. When a node registers with Horizon, it can specify a pattern name to quickly tell Horizon what should be deployed on it. This can only be called by a user.

delete.summary: Deletes a pattern
delete.description: Deletes a pattern. Can only be run by the owning user.

patch.description: Updates one attribute of a pattern. This can only be called by the user that originally created this pattern resource.

get.summary: Returns all patterns
get.description: Returns all pattern definitions in this organization. Can be run by any user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: idfilter
parameters.description: Filter results to only include deployment patterns with this id (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter results to only include deployment patterns with this owner (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: Filter results to only include deployment patterns with this public setting

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Filter results to only include deployment patterns with this label (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter results to only include deployment patterns with this description (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: clusternamespace
parameters.description: Filter results to only include deployment patterns with this cluster namespace (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

post.summary: Returns agreement health of nodes of a particular pattern
post.description: Returns the lastHeartbeat and agreement times for all nodes that are this pattern and have changed since the specified lastTime. Can be run by a user or agbot (but not a node).

post.summary: Returns matching nodes of a particular pattern
post.description: Returns the matching nodes that are using this pattern and do not already have an agreement for the specified service. Can be run by a user or agbot (but not a node).

get.summary: Returns a key/cert for this pattern
get.description: Returns the signing public key/cert with the specified keyid for this pattern. The raw content of the key/cert is returned, not json. Can be run by any credentials able to view the pattern.

put.summary: Adds/updates a key/cert for the pattern
put.description: Adds a new signing public key/cert, or updates an existing key/cert, for this pattern. This can only be run by the pattern owning user.

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: ID of the pattern to be updated.

parameters.name: keyid
parameters.description: ID of the key to be added/updated.

requestBody.description: Note that the input body is just the bytes of the key/cert (not the typical json), so the 'Content-Type' header must be set to 'text/plain'.

delete.summary: Deletes a key of a pattern
delete.description: Deletes a key/cert for this pattern. This can only be run by the pattern owning user.

get.summary: Returns all keys/certs for this pattern
get.description: Returns all the signing public keys/certs for this pattern. Can be run by any credentials able to view the pattern.

delete.summary: Deletes all keys of a pattern
delete.description: Deletes all of the current keys/certs for this pattern. This can only be run by the pattern owning user.

get.summary: Returns all deployment policies
get.description: Returns all deployment policy definitions in this organization. Can be run by any user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: idfilter
parameters.description: Filter results to only include Deployment Policies with this Identifier (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter results to only include Deployment Policies with this Owner (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Filter results to only include Deployment Policies with this Label (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter results to only include Deployment Policies with this Description (can include '%' for wildcard - the URL encoding for '%' is '%25')

get.summary: Returns a deployment policy
get.description: Returns the deployment policy with the specified id. Can be run by a user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only 1 attribute can be specified. If not specified, the entire deployment policy resource will be returned.

put.description: Updates a deployment policy resource. This can only be called by the user that created it.

requestBody.description: Deployment Policy object that needs to be updated. See details in the POST route above.

post.summary: Adds a deployment policy
post.description: Creates a deployment policy resource. A deployment policy resource specifies the service that should be deployed based on the specified properties and constraints. This can only be called by a user.

delete.summary: Deletes a deployment policy
delete.description: Deletes a deployment policy. Can only be run by the owning user.

patch.summary: Updates 1 attribute of a deployment policy
patch.description: Updates one attribute of a deployment policy. This can only be called by the user that originally created this deployment policy resource.

post.summary: Returns matching nodes for this deployment policy
post.description: Returns the matching nodes for this deployment policy that do not already have an agreement for the specified service. Can be run by a user or agbot (but not a node).

get.summary: Returns all node management policies
get.description: Returns all management policy definitions in this organization. Can be run by any user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter results to only include management policies with this description (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: idfilter
parameters.description: Filter results to only include management policies with this id (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Filter results to only include management policies with this label (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: manifest
parameters.description: Filter results to only include management policies with this manifest (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter results to only include management policies with this owner (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

get.summary: Returns a node management policy
get.description: Returns the management policy with the specified id. Can be run by any user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only 1 attribute can be specified. If not specified, the entire management policy resource will be returned.

put.description: Updates a node management policy resource. A node management policy controls the updating of the edge node agents. This can only be called by a user.

post.summary: Adds a node management policy
post.description: Creates a node management policy resource. A node management policy controls the updating of the edge node agents. This can only be called by a user.

delete.summary: Deletes a management policy
delete.description: Deletes a management policy. Can only be run by the owning user.

post.summary: Changes config state of registered services
post.description: Suspends (or resumes) 1 or more services on this edge node. Can be run by the node owner or the node.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: ID of the node to be updated.

get.summary: Returns all nodes (edge devices) with node errors, policy and status. Can be run by any user or agbot.
get.description: Returns all nodes with node errors, policy and status

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this architecture (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this id (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this name (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this type ('device' or 'cluster')

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this owner (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

get.summary: Returns the node errors
get.description: Returns any node errors. Can be run by any user or the node.

put.description: Adds or updates any error of a node. This is called by the node or owning user.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: ID of the node to be updated.

delete.summary: Deletes the error list of a node
delete.description: Deletes the error list of a node. Can be run by the owning user or the node.

post.summary: Tells the exchange this node is still operating
post.description: Lets the exchange know this node is still active so it is still a candidate for contracting. Can be run by the owning user or the node.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: ID of the node to be updated.

get.summary: Returns a node
get.description: Returns the node (edge device) with the specified id. Can be run by that node, a user, or an agbot.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only 1 attribute can be specified, and it must be 1 of the direct attributes of the node resource (not of the services). If not specified, the entire node resource (including services) will be returned

put.description: Adds a new edge node, or updates an existing node. This must be called by the user to add a node, and then can be called by that user or node to update itself.

parameters.name: noheartbeat
parameters.description: If set to 'true', skip the step to update the lastHeartbeat field.

delete.summary: Deletes a node
delete.description: Deletes a node (RPi), and deletes the agreements stored for this node (but does not actually cancel the agreements between the node and agbots). Can be run by the owning user or the node.

patch.description: Updates some attributes of a node. This can be called by the user or the node.

requestBody.description: Specify only **one** of the following attributes

get.summary: Returns all nodes
get.description: Returns all nodes (edge devices). Can be run by any user or agbot.

parameters.name: idfilter
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this id (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this name (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this owner (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: nodetype
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this nodeType ('device' or 'cluster')

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description: Filter results to only include nodes with this arch (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

get.summary: Returns the node policy
get.description: Returns the node run time policy. Can be run by a user or the node.

put.description: Adds or updates the policy of a node. This is called by the node or owning user.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: ID of the node to be updated.

parameters.name: noheartbeat
parameters.description: If set to 'true', skip the step to update the node's lastHeartbeat field.

example.label: human readable name of the node policy

delete.summary: Deletes the policy of a node
delete.description: Deletes the policy of a node. Can be run by the owning user or the node.

get.summary: Returns the node status
get.description: Returns the node run time status, for example service container status. Can be run by a user or the node.

put.description: Adds or updates the run time status of a node. This is called by the node or owning user.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: ID of the node to be updated.

delete.summary: Deletes the status of a node
delete.description: Deletes the status of a node. Can be run by the owning user or the node.

get.summary: Returns an agreement for a node
get.description: Returns the agreement with the specified agid for the specified node id. Can be run by a user or the node.

put.summary: Adds/updates an agreement of a node
put.description: Adds a new agreement of a node, or updates an existing agreement. This is called by the node or owning user to give their information about the agreement.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: ID of the node to be updated.

parameters.name: agid
parameters.description: ID of the agreement to be added/updated.

parameters.name: noheartbeat
parameters.description: If set to 'true', skip the step to update the node's lastHeartbeat field.

delete.summary: Deletes an agreement of a node
delete.description: Deletes an agreement of a node. Can be run by the owning user or the node.

parameters.name: agid
parameters.description: ID of the agreement to be deleted.

get.summary: Returns all agreements this node is in
get.description: Returns all agreements that this node is part of. Can be run by a user or the node.

delete.summary: Deletes all agreements of a node
delete.description: Deletes all of the current agreements of a node. Can be run by the owning user or the node.

get.summary: Returns status for nodeid
get.description: Returns the management status of the node (edge device) with the specified id. Can be run by that node, a user, or an agbot.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only 1 attribute can be specified, and it must be 1 of the direct attributes of the node resource (not of the services). If not specified, the entire node resource (including services) will be returned

parameters.name: mgmtpolicy
parameters.description: ID of the node management policy.

put.summary: Adds/updates the status of the Management Policy running on the Node.
put.description: Adds or updates the run time status of a Management Policy running on a Node. This is called by the Agreement Bot.

delete.summary: Deletes the status of the Management Policy running on the Node
delete.description: Deletes the run time status of a Management Policy running on a Node. This is called by the Agreement Bot.

get.summary: Returns status for nodeid
get.description: Returns the management status of the node (edge device) with the specified id. Can be run by that node, a user, or an agbot.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only 1 attribute can be specified, and it must be 1 of the direct attributes of the node resource (not of the services). If not specified, the entire node resource (including services) will be returned

get.summary: Returns A specific message that has been sent to this node.
get.description: Returns A specific message that has been sent to this node. Deleted/post-TTL (Time To Live) messages will not be returned. Can be run by a user or the node.

delete.summary: Deletes a msg of an node
delete.description: Deletes a message that was sent to an node. This should be done by the node after each msg is read. Can be run by the owning user or the node.

parameters.name: msgid
parameters.description: ID of the msg to be deleted.

get.summary: Returns all msgs sent to this node
get.description: Returns all msgs that have been sent to this node. They will be returned in the order they were sent. All msgs that have been sent to this node will be returned, unless the node has deleted some, or some are past their TTL. Can be run by a user or the node.

parameters.name: maxmsgs
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages returned. If this is less than the number of messages available, the oldest messages are returned. Defaults to unlimited.

post.summary: Sends a msg from an agbot to a node
post.description: Sends a msg from an agbot to a node. The agbot must 1st sign the msg (with its private key) and then encrypt the msg (with the node's public key). Can be run by any agbot.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: ID of the node to send a message to.

get.summary: Lists all members of the specified Node Group (HA Group)
get.description: Returns the Node Group along with the member nodes that the caller has permission to view.

put.summary: Update the nodes that belong to an existing Node Group (HA Group)
put.description: Replaces the list of nodes that belong to the specified node group with the list of nodes provided in the request body.

409.description: node already belongs to other group

post.summary: Insert the nodes that belong to an existing Node Group (HA Group)
post.description: Creates the list of nodes that belong to the specified node group with the list of nodes provided in the request body.

403.description: access denied: node isn't owned by caller

409.description: node already belongs to other group

delete.summary: Deletes a Node Group
delete.description: Deletes a Highly Available Node Group by name

get.summary: Lists all members of all Node Groups (HA Groups)
get.description: Returns all Node Groups in this org along with the member nodes that the caller has permission to view.

post.summary: Insert a Node into a High Availablity Node Group
post.description: Appends to the list of nodes that belong to the specified node group.

403.description: access denied: node isn't owned by caller

409.description: node already belongs to other group

delete.summary: Deletes a Node from a Node Group
delete.description: Deletes a Node from a Highly Available Node Group

post.summary: Returns recent changes in this org
post.description: Returns all the recent resource changes within an org that the caller has permissions to view.

get.summary: Returns the max changeid of the resource changes
get.description: Returns the max changeid of the resource changes. Can be run by the root user, organization admins, or any node or agbot.

post.summary: Returns the orgs a user can view
post.description: Returns all the org definitions in the exchange that match the accounts the caller has access too. Can be run by any user. Request body is the response from /idmgmt/identity/api/v1/users/<user_ID>/accounts API.

get.summary: Returns an org
get.description: Returns the org with the specified id. Can be run by any user in this org or a hub admin.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only 1 attribute can be specified. If not specified, the entire org resource will be returned.

put.description: Does a full replace of an existing org. This can only be called by root, a hub admin, or a user in the org with the admin role.

requestBody.description: Does a full replace of an existing org.

post.summary: Adds an org
post.description: Creates an org resource. This can only be called by the root user or a hub admin.

delete.summary: Deletes an org
delete.description: Deletes an org. This can only be called by root or a hub admin.

patch.description: Updates one attribute of a org. This can only be called by root, a hub admin, or a user in the org with the admin role.

get.summary: Returns all organizations
get.description: Returns some or all organization definitions. Can be run by any resource archetype (Agreement Bot, Node, User). Will at minimum always return the organization of the caller.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Filter results to only include organizations with this description (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Filter results to only include organizations are this, or are like this (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: orgtype
parameters.description: Filter results to only include organizations with this org type. Currently the only supported org type for this route is 'IBM'.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Filter results to only include organizations with this label (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

post.summary: Returns nodes in an error state
post.description: Returns a list of the id's of nodes in an error state. Can be run by a user or agbot (but not a node). No request body is currently required.

get.summary: Returns all node errors
get.description: Returns a list of all the node errors for an organization (that the caller has access to see) in an error state. Can be run by a user or agbot.

post.summary: Returns agreement health of nodes with no pattern
post.description: Returns the lastHeartbeat and agreement times for all nodes in this org that do not have a pattern and have had a heartbeat since the specified lastTime. Can be run by an organization admin or agbot (but not a node).

post.summary: Returns the nodes a service is running on
post.description: Returns a list of all the nodes a service is running on. Can be run by a user or agbot (but not a node).

get.summary: Returns the service policy
get.description: Returns the service policy. Can be run by a user, node or agbot.

put.description: Adds or updates the policy of a service. This can be called by the owning user.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: ID of the service to be updated.

example.label: human readable name of the service policy

delete.summary: Deletes the policy of a service
delete.description: Deletes the policy of a service. Can be run by the owning user.

get.summary: Returns a service
get.description: Returns the service with the specified id. Can be run by a user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: Which attribute value should be returned. Only 1 attribute can be specified. If not specified, the entire service resource will be returned

put.description: Does a full replace of an existing service. See the description of the body fields in the POST method. This can only be called by the user that originally created it.

delete.summary: Deletes a service
delete.description: Deletes a service. Can only be run by the owning user.

patch.description: Updates one attribute of a service. This can only be called by the user that originally created this service resource.

get.summary: Returns all services
get.description: Returns all service definitions in this organization. Can be run by any user, node, or agbot.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Filter results to only include services with this owner (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: Filter results to only include services with this public setting

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Filter results to only include services with this url (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Filter results to only include services with this version (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: arch
parameters.description: Filter results to only include services with this arch (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

parameters.name: nodetype
parameters.description: Filter results to only include services that are deployable on this nodeType. Valid values: devices or clusters

parameters.name: requiredurl
parameters.description: Filter results to only include services that use this service with this url (can include % for wildcard - the URL encoding for % is %25)

post.summary: Adds a service
post.description: A service resource contains the metadata that Horizon needs to deploy the docker images that implement this service. A service can either be an edge application, or a lower level edge service that provides access to sensors or reusable features. The service can require 1 or more other services that Horizon should also deploy when deploying this service. If public is set to true, the service can be shared across organizations. This can only be called by a user.

get.summary: Returns a docker image token for this service
get.description: Returns the docker image authentication token with the specified dockauthid for this service. Can be run by any credentials able to view the service.

put.summary: Updates a docker image token for the service
put.description: Updates an existing docker image authentication token for this service. This can only be run by the service owning user.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: ID of the service to be updated.

requestBody.description: See the POST route for details.

delete.summary: Deletes a docker image auth token of a service
delete.description: Deletes a docker image auth token for this service. This can only be run by the service owning user.

get.summary: Returns all docker image tokens for this service
get.description: Returns all the docker image authentication tokens for this service. Can be run by any credentials able to view the service.

post.summary: Adds a docker image token for the service
post.description: Adds a new docker image authentication token for this service. As an optimization, if a dockauth resource already exists with the same service, registry, username, and token, this method will just update that lastupdated field. This can only be run by the service owning user.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: ID of the service to be updated.

delete.summary: Deletes all docker image auth tokens of a service
delete.description: Deletes all of the current docker image auth tokens for this service. This can only be run by the service owning user.

get.summary: Returns a key/cert for this service
get.description: Returns the signing public key/cert with the specified keyid for this service. The raw content of the key/cert is returned, not json. Can be run by any credentials able to view the service.

put.summary: Adds/updates a key/cert for the service
put.description: Adds a new signing public key/cert, or updates an existing key/cert, for this service. This can only be run by the service owning user.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: ID of the service to be updated.

parameters.name: keyid
parameters.description: ID of the key to be added/updated.

requestBody.description: Note that the input body is just the bytes of the key/cert (not the typical json), so the 'Content-Type' header must be set to 'text/plain'.

delete.summary: Deletes a key of a service
delete.description: Deletes a key/cert for this service. This can only be run by the service owning user.

get.summary: Returns all keys/certs for this service
get.description: Returns all the signing public keys/certs for this service. Can be run by any credentials able to view the service.

delete.summary: Deletes all keys of a service
delete.description: Deletes all of the current keys/certs for this service. This can only be run by the service owning user.

post.summary: Changes the user's password
post.description: Changes the user's password. Only the user itself, root, or a user with admin privilege can update an existing user's password.

post.summary: Confirms if this username/password is valid
post.description: Confirms whether or not this username exists and has the specified password. This can only be called by root or a user in the org with the admin role.

get.summary: Returns a user
get.description: Returns the specified username. Can only be run by that user or root.

put.description: Updates an existing user. Only the user itself, root, or a user with admin privilege can update an existing user.

requestBody.description: See details in the POST route.

post.summary: Adds a user
post.description: Creates a new user. This can be run root/root, or a user with admin privilege. This endpoint is not allowed in OAuth mode.

delete.summary: Deletes a user
delete.description: Deletes a user and all of its nodes and agbots. This can only be called by root or a user in the org with the admin role.

patch.description: Updates 1 attribute of an existing user. Only the user itself, root, or a user with admin privilege can update an existing user.

get.summary: Returns current user info
get.description: Returns the authenticated user's own information using apikey authentication.

get.summary: Returns all users
get.description: Returns all users. Can only be run by the root user, org admins, and hub admins.

get.summary: Get an API key by ID
get.description: Returns API key with the given ID. Must be called by the user on their own behalf (if they are the owner) or by an organization admin.

200 - API key resource.description: The response body for an API key resource

delete.summary: Delete an API key for a user
delete.description: Deletes API key with the given ID. Must be called by the user themselves (if they are the owner) or an organization admin.

post.summary: Create a new API key for a user
post.description: Creates a new API key for the specified user. Can be called by the user or org admin.

With description and label.description: Create API key with an optional description and label

With description.description: Create API key with an optional description

With label.description: Create API key with an optional label

Without description and label.description: Create API key with no optional request body parameters
